abstract: Updated at 7:39 p.m. Timothy F. Geithner was confirmed Monday night by the Senate as the secretary of the Treasury after a sizable bipartisan majority concluded that his experience in government and finance outweighed concerns about recent disclosures that he had been delinquent in paying about $34,000 in taxes, The New York Times’s Jackie Calmes reports from Washington.
lead_paragraph: Updated at 7:39 p.m. Timothy F. Geithner was confirmed Monday night by the Senate as the secretary of the Treasury after a sizable bipartisan majority concluded that his experience in government and finance outweighed concerns about recent disclosures that he had been delinquent in paying about $34,000 in taxes, The New York Times’s Jackie Calmes reports from Washington.

headline.main: Senate Confirms Geithner as Treasury Secretary
